about.name: Sydney
about.info_text: Sydney is a bustling and cosmopolitan city located on the east coast of Australia. Known for its iconic landmarks, such as the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, Sydney is a city of natural beauty, with stunning beaches, parks, and gardens. Visitors can experience the vibrant culture of Sydney, with world-class museums, galleries, and theaters, as well as the city's famous food and wine scene. Whether you're looking to explore the city's rich history, soak up some sun on the beach, or indulge in some retail therapy, Sydney has something for everyone.
about.facts_text:
Population: 5,367,206
State: New South Wales
Time Zone: Australian Eastern Standard Time (UTC+10:00)
Language: English
Currency: Australian dollar (AUD)
about.climate_text: Sydney has a temperate climate with mild winters and warm summers. Average temperatures range from 8째C (46째F) in winter to 25째C (77째F) in summer, with plenty of sunshine and blue skies throughout the year. Remember to pack sunscreen and a hat, as well as a light jacket for cooler evenings.

attractions_card.title: Sydney Opera House
attractions_card.description: The iconic Sydney Opera House is a world-famous performing arts venue and one of Australia's most recognizable landmarks. Visitors can take a guided tour, attend a show or concert, or simply admire the stunning architecture and views of the harbour.

attractions_card.title: Sydney Harbour Bridge
attractions_card.description: The 'Coathanger' as it is affectionately known, is a steel arch bridge that spans Sydney Harbour. Visitors can climb to the top for breathtaking views of the city and harbour, or take a guided tour to learn about the history and construction of the bridge.

attractions_card.title: Bondi Beach
attractions_card.description: One of Australia's most famous beaches, Bondi Beach is a lively spot for swimming, surfing, sunbathing, and people-watching. Visitors can also explore the surrounding coastal walks and enjoy the vibrant beachside community.

attractions_card.title: Darling Harbour
attractions_card.description: This bustling waterfront precinct is home to a variety of attractions, including the SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium, the Australian National Maritime Museum, and the Darling Harbour playground. Visitors can also take a harbour cruise or enjoy a meal at one of the many restaurants and bars.

food_card.title: Fish and Chips
food_card.description: Try one of Sydney's most iconic dishes, fish and chips, at one of the many seaside restaurants or takeaway shops.

food_card.title: Pavlova
food_card.description: Indulge in a classic Australian dessert, pavlova, a meringue-based cake topped with fresh fruit and cream.

food_card.title: Craft Beer
food_card.description: Sample some of Sydney's best craft beer at local breweries and pubs, such as Young Henrys, Batch Brewing Company, and The Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel.

hotels_card.title: Park Hyatt Sydney
hotels_card.description: Experience luxury and comfort at this 5-star hotel located in the heart of the city, with stunning views of the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

hotels_card.title: QT Sydney
hotels_card.description: Stay in style at this trendy boutique hotel, located in a beautifully restored historic building in the city center.

hotels_card.title: The Langham, Sydney
hotels_card.description: Relax in elegance and sophistication at this 5-star hotel, located in the heart of the historic Rocks district.

transport_card.title: Train
transport_card.description: Take advantage of Sydney's extensive train network to explore the city and its surrounding areas, including the beautiful Blue Mountains.

transport_card.title: Ferry
transport_card.description: Enjoy breathtaking views of Sydney Harbour while traveling by ferry to popular destinations such as Manly, Taronga Zoo, and Watsons Bay.

transport_card.title: Bike Rentals
transport_card.description: Explore Sydney on two wheels with a bike rental from companies such as Sydney Bike Tours, Bonza Bike Tours, or BlueBananas.
